g.text: PERSON INTERVIEWEDDATE OF INTERVIEWTIME OF INTERVIEWCASE NUMBERINTERVIEW CONDUCTED BYTRANSCRIBED BY
Officer: What was your role at Raytheon Technologies?
Theodore: I made sure any potential contracts came through.
Officer: Raytheon just signed a big contract with the government,were you involved in that?
Theodore: Yes, I went to Washington, D.C. myself to have them sign the contract.
Officer: You must have a lot of authority around here then, plenty of access to company information.
Theodore: I know what I need to know to do my job.
Officer: So you felt that Mr. DeVaul was running the company well? Not jeopardizing any important information?
Theodore: If you’re referring to Alice, that’s none of my business. I come to work at 9 and I leave at 5, I’m not involved in the office politics.
Officer: Sure, maybe you’re not involved in the officepolitics but surely you have an interest in the politics of United States. Considering what’s happening and all.
Theodore: My country of origin has nothing to do with how I do my job, I’m loyal to this company and this country.
